DOC.brief_summary: Breast Success new direct service program focus overcome barrier breastfeed low-income inner-city mother use culturally competent home-based educational support intervention . Key project component include new Enhanced Breastfeeding Curriculum brief engage health literacy focus module , two innovative support plan , Breastfeeding Doula Father Support Programs . The objective increase breastfeed rate high-risk inner-city mother . Research Questions evaluate project feasibility effectiveness : 1 . Were aspect Curriculum Doula Father Support Programs implement ? 2 . Is increase rate breastfeed 1 month postpartum mother ? 3 . Is difference rate breastfeed 1 month postpartum intervention ( Curriculum , Curriculum+Doula Support , Curriculum+Father Support ) ? 4 . What exclusive breastfeeding rate 1 , 3 6 month mother ?
DOC.brief_title: Breast Success : A Family-Centered Intervention Support Breastfeeding Among High-risk Low-income Mothers
DOC.detailed_description: Low rate breastfeed among low-income inner-city mother represent challenge health disparity adversely impact child maternal health . The overall objective Breast Success increase rate breastfeed initiation , continuation exclusivity among high-risk mother City Cleveland via home-based culturally appropriate intervention . Key project component include new Curriculum brief engage module utilize game , teach-reteach strategy , interactive learning address specific barrier identified focus group ( e.g . pain , low milk supply , breast `` myth '' ) , two innovative support component , Breastfeeding Doula Father Support Programs . Breast Success develop collaboration disseminate partnership Cleveland Department Public Health MomsFirst initiative ( Healthy Start Program ) , delivers comprehensive service include twice-monthly Community Health Worker home visit prenatally 2 year postpartum 500 woman annually . The investigator measure program success via participation log , satisfaction questionnaire breastfeed rate 1 , 3 6 month postpartum .
DOC.criteria: pregnant woman enrol MomsFirst Program Greater Cleveland incarceration Other study population include Community Health Workers , doulas father study mother .
